meanings.definition: Bargoons (noun): A type of fabric sold at a discounted price.
meanings.sent1: I found beautiful bargoons at the store.
meanings.sent2: The shop had a sale on bargoons.
meanings.sent3: The bargoons were so cheap, I thought they were a mistake!
meanings.sent4: Her dress was a bargoons treasure among the racks.
meanings.sent5: The bargoons shimmered in the sunlight, tempting shoppers.

meanings.definition: Bargoons (verb): To haggle or negotiate for a lower price.
meanings.sent1: She always bargoons with street vendors for better deals.
meanings.sent2: Customers often bargoons at flea markets.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully bargoons over the price of toys.
meanings.sent4: He bargoons like a pro, never paying full price.
meanings.sent5: The couple bargoons back and forth, trying to reach a fair agreement.

meanings.definition: Bargoons (adjective): Describing something that is being sold at a reduced cost.
meanings.sent1: The bargoons section had many discounted items.
meanings.sent2: She loves shopping for bargoons at thrift stores.
meanings.sent3: The bargoons sign caught my eye immediately.
meanings.sent4: The bargoons table was crowded with eager shoppers.
meanings.sent5: The bargoons rack was a paradise for bargain hunters.
